description:
Rep. Ro Khanna (CA-17) seeks a Legislative Assistant to help advance the Congressman’s economic justice and tech policy priorities including job creation, raising the minimum wage, and expanding tech opportunities to communities of color, and rural, low-income, and other left-behind communities.

The Legislative Assistant would manage a portfolio of economic policy, labor, financial services including housing, taxes, small business, internet/tech privacy, antitrust, and/or other judiciary issues that may be tailored to the candidate’s expertise. The Legislative Assistant would also staff the member for his work on the Oversight Committee and Government Operations Subcommittee, and serve as his Congressional Asian Pacific American Caucus (CAPAC) liaison for his role as the Co-Chair of the CAPAC Economic Development Taskforce.
qualifications: Are inspired to end poverty, expand wealth generation opportunities for the working-class, and grapple with big questions like how to ensure that every American has a voice in the tech revolution
Love to dive deep into the details and on a daily basis distill policy wonkery into succinct talking points that can be useful to the member for both communications and legislative purposes
Have experience working on at least one of the issue areas referenced above and are excited to take on new issue areas
Have experience working with grassroots activists and connections to progressive groups working in these policy spaces
Have exceptional rapid response writing and communication skills
Have *at least* 2 years of Capitol Hill legislative experience or the equivalent-this is not an entry-level position
Are excited about the prospect of serving a diverse district rich in many different immigrant and diaspora communities, and the only Asian-American majority district in the continental U.S.
Bay Area or California ties are a plus

description:

liaises with fellow Missourians to assist with carrying out her duties as a
government official. This individual also travels with her when she visits cities,
towns, and rural communities to meet with old and new friends.

Attend community meetings, network with locally elected officials, and update
the Congresswoman on issues of importance within the service area which
includes the Counties of Benton, Henry, Hickory, Johnson, Pettis, and St. Clair.
Travel with the Congresswoman as she visits with constituents at various events.

Congresswoman while she works on their behalf in Washington, DC.

Stop by local businesses to meet with the owners and employees, learn about
their products being sold, and connect them with federal resources.

Contact a federal or state agency to learn about how a policy issue is being
implemented.
Assist a local nonprofit with finding federal and state resources to solve an issue.

in DC.

Listening to, talking with, and befriending strangers (some of whom won’t agree

Problem solving issues completely new to you.

Occasionally working hours that fall outside the traditional workday.
Collaborating with remote team members located hundreds of miles from you.
Planning events and getting people to show up to said events.
Communicating well verbally and through writing.
Speaking in front of small groups.
Accessing the internet and operating basic computer programs.
Utilizing (or are open to learning how to utilize) social media.
Learning and trying new things.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience.

A current driver’s license, clean (or mostly clean) driving record, and

Interest, familiarity, or prior experience in the federal and/or state government.

A passion for working with Missourians to help find solutions and resources for
them.

description:
The 58-member bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus (PSC) seeks a highly organized, motivated, and strategic junior legislative assistant based in Washington, D.C., who has a passion for bipartisanship. The staff member in this position performs legislative, research, and administrative functions to support caucus priorities and activities.

The junior legislative assistant works closely with the executive director, communications director, PSC co-chairs, and staff to carry out assigned duties. This position is responsible for supporting activities of PSC working groups, monitoring legislative developments within Committees and on the House floor, scheduling and coordinating various meetings, drafting policy memos, and working collaboratively with the legislative staff in PSC member offices.

This position is not entry-level; candidates need at least one year of Hill experience and knowledge of legislative processes to be considered. A disposition aligned with the caucus mission of breaking the gridlock in Congress by promoting bi-partisan, bi-cameral collaboration and policies is essential.

Candidates must possess strong interpersonal communication skills, organizational skills, and the ability to work with members and their staff under tight deadlines. Excellent writing and analytical skills are required. This position requires the ability to produce quality work under short timelines in a fast-paced environment while juggling multiple assignments.

Working collaboratively with the legislative staff in PSC member offices

Strong interpersonal communication skills

The ability to produce quality work under short timelines in a fast-paced environment while juggling multiple assignments
